org.divxdede.swing.busy.ui

Class BasicBusyLayerUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.plaf.ComponentUI
      • org.jdesktop.jxlayer.plaf.LayerUI<V>
        • org.jdesktop.jxlayer.plaf.AbstractLayerUI<V>
          • org.jdesktop.jxlayer.plaf.AbstractBufferedLayerUI<JComponent>
            • org.jdesktop.jxlayer.plaf.ext.LockableUI
              • org.divxdede.swing.busy.ui.AbstractBusyLayerUI
                • org.divxdede.swing.busy.ui.BasicBusyLayerUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Serializable, EventListener, BusyLayerUI

    public class BasicBusyLayerUI
extends AbstractBusyLayerUI
    A Default implementation of BusyLayerUI.

    This UI provide a busy animation, progress bar and cancellation button regarding the BusyModel.

    You can enhance any swing components with busy fonctionnality like it: 

          // your component to enhance
      JComponent comp = .....;
 
      // Create the JXLayer decorator
      JXLayer layer = new JXLayer(comp);
 
      // Create the Busy Layer UI delegate
      BusyLayerUI ui = new BasicBusyLayerUI();
 
      // Attach the UI to the decorator
      layer.setUI( (LayerUI)ui );
 
      // Add the decorator to the container instead of our component
      myContainer.add( layer );
 
      // Use the BusyModel for control the busy state on our component
      // If multiple components share the same BusyModel, all of theses will be
      // triggered by the same model
      BusyModel model = ui.getBusyModel();
      model.setBusy(true); // an animation over our component is shown
    Author:
    André Sébastien (divxdede)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • BasicBusyLayerUI

        public BasicBusyLayerUI(int shadeDelay,
                float veilAlpha,
                Color veilColor)
        Basic Implementation with shading configuration's
        Parameters:
        shadeDelay - Shading delay in milliseconds for render busy state change, 0 means no shading
        shadeFps - Frame per Seconds to use for render the shading animation.
        veilAlpha - Alpha ratio to use for the veil when the model is busy
        veilColor - Color to use for render the veil

      • setMillisToDecideToPopup

        public void setMillisToDecideToPopup(int millisToDecideToPopup)
        Specifies the amount of time to wait before deciding whether or not to make busy the component when it's underlying model is.

        This feature purpose is to prevent to show a progress bar for a very very short time.
        This BusyLayerUI wait few times (300ms by default) and decide to popup the progress bar or not.

        With a determinate model, the decision was made by computing a predicted remaining time of the underlying task.
        If the remaining time is long enough (>= 1200ms by default), the progress bar will shown.
        With an undeterminate model, this layer consider that it must render the busy state after the decision time is reach.

        When the model gone busy, the component is instantly locked (can't be accessed anymore) even if the progress bar is not yet visible.

        Setting a 0 value or any negative value disable this feature. In this case, the progress bar will popup instantly when the model become busy.

        Parameters:
        millisToDecideToPopup - an int specifying the time to wait, in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        getMillisToDecideToPopup()

      • getMillisToDecideToPopup

        public int getMillisToDecideToPopup()
        Returns the amount of time this object waits before deciding whether or not to propage the busy state from the model to the component.

        This feature purpose is to prevent to show a progress bar for a very very short time.
        This BusyLayerUI wait few times (300ms by default) and decide to popup the progress bar or not.

        With a determinate model, the decision was made by computing a predicted remaining time of the underlying task.
        If the remaining time is long enough (>= 1200ms by default), the progress bar will shown.
        With an undeterminate model, this layer consider that it must render the busy state after the decision time is reach.

        When the model gone busy, the component is instantly locked (can't be accessed anymore) even if the progress bar is not yet visible.

        Getting a 0 value or any negative value indicate a disabled feature.
        In this case, the progress bar will popup instantly when the model become busy.

        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        setMillisToDecideToPopup(int)

      • setMillisToPopup

        public void setMillisToPopup(int millisToPopup)
        Specifies the amount of remaining time required when this object take it's decision.

        After getMillisToDecideToPopup(), this layer compute the remaining time's job,
        If its long enough regarding this property, the progress bar will be shown.

        This feature purpose is to prevent to show a progress bar for a very very short time.
        This BusyLayerUI wait few times (300ms by default) and decide to popup the progress bar or not.

        With a determinate model, the decision was made by computing a predicted remaining time of the underlying task.
        If the remaining time is long enough (>= 1200ms by default), the progress bar will shown.
        With an undeterminate model, this layer consider that it must render the busy state after the decision time is reach.

        When the model gone busy, the component is instantly locked (can't be accessed anymore) even if the progress bar is not yet visible.

        Setting a 0 value or any negative value disable this feature. In this case, the progress bar will popup instantly when the model become busy.

        Parameters:
        millisToPopup - an int specifying the time in milliseconds
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        getMillisToPopup()

      • setRemainingTimeVisible

        public void setRemainingTimeVisible(boolean value)
        Define if this BusyLayerUI should show the remaining time of the job underlying the busy state.

        This feature works only with determinate BusyModel

        Parameters:
        value - set to true to show the remaining time when a determinate model is busy
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        isRemainingTimeVisible()

      • isRemainingTimeVisible

        public boolean isRemainingTimeVisible()
        Indicate if this BusyLayerUI should show the remaining time of the job underlying the busy state

        This feature works only with determinate BusyModel

        Returns:
        true of the remaining time should by shown
        Since:
        1.2

      • isComponentBusy

        protected boolean isComponentBusy()
        Indicate if the component should be busy.

        If you use getMillisToDecideToPopup() and getMillisToPopup(), the component will not be busy instantly when the model is. This layer will take time to predict the remaining time and decide if the component would be busy or not.

        Returns:
        true if the component would be busy

      • shouldLock

        protected boolean shouldLock()
        Indicate if this layer should be placed in a locked state. This default implementation return true if the model is "busy" OR the background animation is not ended.

        Whenever the component is not yet busy because we wait some times to decide if progression would popup, the component will be locked instantly (when model is busy) anyway to prevent any access during the job.

        Overrides:
        shouldLock in class AbstractBusyLayerUI

      • createBackgroundPainter

        protected Painter createBackgroundPainter(int alpha)
        Overridable method that neeed to create a painter with a specified alpha level. BasicBusyLayerUI invoke this method each time requested for paint the shadowing animation.
        Parameters:
        alpha - The alpha value (0 ~ 255) requested for the painter
        Returns:
        painter the new painter with the correct alpha value
